column3: The Los Angeles Temple feels like an oasis of peace in the midst of hectic traffic and city bustle. Although only qualified members of the Church can enter the temple, there is an excellent visitors center on site which has many hands-on displays, visuals, videos, etc. Everyone is welcome to spend time at the visitors center or to stroll the well-maintained grounds.Inside the Temple itself are beautiful wall murals and other paintings that cause one to reflect upon God and His love for us.

Even though we didn't get to go inside the temple itself, the visitor's center was full of interactive learning and stories to be heard. Our girl's loved spending time here and exploring the temple grounds. Our whole family felt a special spirit here. It was a sanctuary; away from the hustle and bustle of the big city.
This is a beautiful building with well maintained grounds and nice water features. Anyone is welcome to go inside the visitors center and walk around the grounds. Ample, free parking.

column2: A Touch of Peace in a busy city
column3: My bride and I stopped by here during our LA trip. It was a quiet repose from the noise of the city. To enter the temple itself, one must be an active member of the sponsoring church. The Visitor's Center, however, is open to everyone.

column2: Breath of fresh air in busy LA
column3: The temple has the most beautiful grounds with flowers galore. Only members can go inside the actual temple, but there is a lovely visitors center that is open to all and free to visit. Peaceful and beautiful stop.

What a beautiful LDS Temple amongst all the smog and craziness around it. The grounds are beautiful and impeccably kept. We took the time to visit the visitors center and look at all the statues they have out front of the pioneers. Definitely worth the stop.
Great place to visit and find serenity among the chaos. Beautiful to look at and has a pretty garden all around.
Free to walk around and easy parking. Good location to relax. Peaceful and interesting architecture.

The volunteers make a first-time visit very enjoyable. President Clark, a counselor and the Temple presidency was an absolute sweetheart along with his spouse. He helped us all to understand more and to feel comfortable in the house of the Lord. The grounds are very, very well-maintained!

column2: Beautiful, Peaceful - Los Angeles Caliornia Temple (Westwood Los Angeles)
column3: We visited the Los Angeles California Temple. Its the second largest temple operated by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. Its on Santa Monica Blvd in the Westwood area of Los Angeles.It was first dedicated in 1956.The grounds area are a very nice garden area with local plants such as bird of paradise, fountains and a reflecting pool.
